text.body:
talaimakaṭku vanta nōy murukaṉāl vantamai ikkaḻaṅku kūṟiṟṟu eṉṟu vēlaṉ coṉṉāṉ eṉpatu kēṭṭa tōḻi akkaḻaṅkiṟku uraippāḷāyc cevili kēṭkumāṟṟāl aṟattoṭu nilai kuṟittuc colliyatu
What the friend, standing [in accordance] with duty, said as one who spoke to the Molucca-bean by the way of foster-mother listening; [the friend who] listened to the Vēlaṉ who said that this Molucca-bean declared the pain that had befallen the heroine to have come about by Murukaṉ.
poypaṭu paṟiyāk kaḻaṅkē meyyē
maṇivaraik kaṭci maṭamayi lālu nam
malarnta vaḷḷiyaṅ kāṉaṅ kiḻavō
ṉāṇṭakai viṟalvē ḷallaṉivaḷ
pūṇṭāṅ kiḷamulai yaṇaṅki yōṉē
Oh Molucca-bean unaware of the occurrence of falsehood,
the truth, in fact,
is that he who tormented her ornament-bearing young breasts,
– our master of the forest with bloomed creepers,
where naïve peacocks dance in the nests of sapphire mountains,
is not the victorious Vēḷ worthy of manhood.
